content: "http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2009/04/30/politics/main4980134.shtml?tag=topHome;topStories" AP) An Obama administration policy to go after employers who knowingly hire and exploit illegal workers is not significantly different from the Bush administration strategy, according to a copy of the guidelines, obtained by The Associated Press. The new guidelines for immigration agents, which the Homeland Security Department calls a "renewed department-wide focus" will impose fines and criminal charges against employers who break the law. While the priority is to go after employers, the policy states that agents will continue to arrest illegal workers. The Barack Obama policy, however, stresses that humanitarian guidelines will be followed more broadly than in the previous administration. Homeland Security Secretary Janet Napolitano has said that under her leadership the agency will now be focused on "renewing a priority on employers who are making money off of these illegal immigrants and giving them jobs that should be going to American workers, as opposed to just counting numbers." In 2008, Immigration and Customs Enforcement brought criminal charges against 135 employers and 968 workers. In an interview with The Associated Press earlier this month, Napolitano said using investigative tools such as auditing documents employees fill out when they join a company, having illegal workers go undercover and talking to people who regularly interact with the employers are all ways to build a case against a business that hires illegal workers. "What I want to do is deter more employers from intentionally and knowingly hiring illegal workers," Napolitano said.

The new guidelines for immigration agents, which the Homeland Security Department calls a "renewed department-wide focus" will impose fines and criminal charges against employers who break the law. The Barack Obama policy, however, stresses that humanitarian guidelines will be followed more broadly than in the previous administration. Homeland Security Secretary Janet Napolitano has said that under her leadership the agency will now be focused on "renewing a priority on employers who are making money off of these illegal immigrants and giving them jobs that should be going to American workers, as opposed to just counting numbers." In 2008, Immigration and Customs Enforcement brought criminal charges against 135 employers and 968 workers. In an interview with The Associated Press earlier this month, Napolitano said using investigative tools such as auditing documents employees fill out when they join a company, having illegal workers go undercover and talking to people who regularly interact with the employers are all ways to build a case against a business that hires illegal workers. "What I want to do is deter more employers from intentionally and knowingly hiring illegal workers," Napolitano said.
title: Government Going After Hiring Of Illegals

content: Correction: those that KNOWINGLY hire illegals are greedy. they are representative of neither republicans nor democrats. they are just greedy money grubbing profiteers who would be just as happy owning slaves, but settle for second best. people who KNOWINGLY hire illegals deserve nothing short of prison time. as for the rest (the ones who we can't prove KNOWINGLY hired illegals) they get stiff fines the first time. if there is a second time the business gets shut down while the hireing practices get reviewed/changed. there is no third time, or it is assumed that the owner KNOWINGLY hired illegals. illegal immigration has got to be stopped. and Mr Obama's plan is the best so far... the kinks in E-verify need to be fixed soon. that is one of the best plans so far, but there is TOO MUCH ROOM FOR ERROR in it still (1 out of 5)

The new guidelines for immigration agents, which the Homeland Security Department calls a "renewed department-wide focus" will impose fines and criminal charges against employers who break the law. While the priority is to go after employers, the policy states that agents will continue to arrest illegal workers. The Barack Obama policy, however, stresses that humanitarian guidelines will be followed more broadly than in the previous administration. Homeland Security Secretary Janet Napolitano has said that under her leadership the agency will now be focused on "renewing a priority on employers who are making money off of these illegal immigrants and giving them jobs that should be going to American workers, as opposed to just counting numbers." In 2008, Immigration and Customs Enforcement brought criminal charges against 135 employers and 968 workers. In an interview with The Associated Press earlier this month, Napolitano said using investigative tools such as auditing documents employees fill out when they join a company, having illegal workers go undercover and talking to people who regularly interact with the employers are all ways to build a case against a business that hires illegal workers. "What I want to do is deter more employers from intentionally and knowingly hiring illegal workers," Napolitano said.

Pretty much what I was going to say. Having a policy and ACTUALLY enforcing the policy are 2 differentt hings and IMO the Bsuh admin did NOT go after the employers and in fact often protected them. Now we just have to wait and see if the Obama admin actually enforces a policy of going after the employers or just pretends like the Bush admin did.

content: Correction: those that KNOWINGLY hire illegals are greedy. they are representative of neither republicans nor democrats. they are just greedy money grubbing profiteers who would be just as happy owning slaves, but settle for second best. people who KNOWINGLY hire illegals deserve nothing short of prison time. as for the rest (the ones who we can't prove KNOWINGLY hired illegals) they get stiff fines the first time. if there is a second time the business gets shut down while the hireing practices get reviewed/changed. there is no third time, or it is assumed that the owner KNOWINGLY hired illegals. illegal immigration has got to be stopped. and Mr Obama's plan is the best so far... the kinks in E-verify need to be fixed soon. that is one of the best plans so far, but there is TOO MUCH ROOM FOR ERROR in it still (1 out of 5)
reply: Correction: those that KNOWINGLY hire illegals are greedy. they are representative of neither republicans nor democrats. they are just greedy money grubbing profiteers who would be just as happy owning slaves, but settle for second best. people who KNOWINGLY hire illegals deserve nothing short of prison time. as for the rest (the ones who we can't prove KNOWINGLY hired illegals) they get stiff fines the first time. if there is a second time the business gets shut down while the hireing practices get reviewed/changed. there is no third time, or it is assumed that the owner KNOWINGLY hired illegals. illegal immigration has got to be stopped. and Mr Obama's plan is the best so far... the kinks in E-verify need to be fixed soon. that is one of the best plans so far, but there is TOO MUCH ROOM FOR ERROR in it still (1 out of 5)

title: Government Going After Hiring Of Illegals

content: quote: illegal immigration has got to be stopped. and Mr Obama's plan is the best so far... How is giving them automatic citizenship stopping illegal immigration? That is what the donkeys want to do. quote: Smoke and mirrors! Those illegals are potential voters for the Democrats so they show only a token interest in deporting any of them. Watch as they get amnesty down the line. Nothing stops them from voting now in places like California and New York and other places where motor voter allows them to register when they conduct business at the motor vehicle offices. No one is asking their status there and since the paperwork used to verify their status later is provided by the illegals themselves during the licensing process it is very difficult to catch them. quote: This is also the same adm that didnt want any provisions in the bailouts bills to keep the govt from hiring illegals. Spare me the enforcement bs! And there is the proof that the donkeys have no intention of doing anything else than allowing the dilution of American culture, language and borders to continue.
quote: illegal immigration has got to be stopped. and Mr Obama's plan is the best so far...
reply: How is giving them automatic citizenship stopping illegal immigration? That is what the donkeys want to do. quote: Smoke and mirrors! Nothing stops them from voting now in places like California and New York and other places where motor voter allows them to register when they conduct business at the motor vehicle offices. No one is asking their status there and since the paperwork used to verify their status later is provided by the illegals themselves during the licensing process it is very difficult to catch them. quote: This is also the same adm that didnt want any provisions in the bailouts bills to keep the govt from hiring illegals.
